headline: Facing Long Odds, a Candidate Tries to Make Up for Lost Time
abstract: Nearly two months after his unusually late entry into the presidential race, the former Massachusetts governor has failed to draw big headlines or crucial endorsements. But he still has a long-shot plan.
lead_paragraph: MANCHESTER, N.H. — Deval Patrick was eyeing the mug of bacon, the signature menu item at the Red Arrow Diner, a greasy spoon across the street from his presidential campaign’s new state headquarters.
